chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
X: Type
j: nat
Q2: list X
Q1: list X
i: nat
I: X

Goal:
(i, I :: nil) <sc (j, Q1 ++ Q2) -> (i, I :: nil) <sc (j, Q1) \/ (i, I :: nil) <sc (length Q1 + j, Q2)

Premises:
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
length : forall A : Type, list A -> nat
subcode_cons_inj : forall (i : nat) (ρ δ : X) P, (i, ρ :: nil) <sc P -> (i, δ :: nil) <sc P -> ρ = δ
in_code_subcode : forall (i : nat) P, in_code i P -> exists a : X, (i, a :: nil) <sc P
Lexicographic_Exponentiation.ltl_unit : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (x : list A) (a b : A), Relation_Operators.Desc A leA (x ++ a :: nil) -> Relation_Operators.Ltl A leA (x ++ a :: nil) (b :: nil) -> Relation_Operators.Ltl A leA x (b :: nil)
Relation_Operators.d_conc : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (x y : A) (l : list A), Relation_Operators.clos_refl A leA x y -> Relation_Operators.Desc A leA (l ++ y :: nil) -> Relation_Operators.Desc A leA ((l ++ y :: nil) ++ x :: nil)
Lexicographic_Exponentiation.desc_end : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (a b : A) (x : list A), Relation_Operators.Desc A leA (x ++ a :: nil) /\ Relation_Operators.Ltl A leA (x ++ a :: nil) (b :: nil) -> Relation_Operators.clos_trans A leA a b
last_length : forall (A : Type) (l : list A) (a : A), length (l ++ a :: nil) = S (length l)
subcode_cons : forall P (n : nat) (x : X) (l : list X), P <sc (1 + n, l) -> P <sc (n, x :: l)
Relation_Operators.Desc_sind : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (P : list A -> SProp), P nil -> (forall x : A, P (x :: nil)) -> (forall (x y : A) (l : list A), Relation_Operators.clos_refl A leA x y -> Relation_Operators.Desc A leA (l ++ y :: nil) -> P (l ++ y :: nil) -> P ((l ++ y :: nil) ++ x :: nil)) -> forall l : list A, Relation_Operators.Desc A leA l -> P l
Relation_Operators.Desc_ind : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (P : list A -> Prop), P nil -> (forall x : A, P (x :: nil)) -> (forall (x y : A) (l : list A), Relation_Operators.clos_refl A leA x y -> Relation_Operators.Desc A leA (l ++ y :: nil) -> P (l ++ y :: nil) -> P ((l ++ y :: nil) ++ x :: nil)) -> forall l : list A, Relation_Operators.Desc A leA l -> P l
Inductive Desc (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) : list A -> Prop := d_nil : Relation_Operators.Desc A leA nil | d_one : forall x : A, Relation_Operators.Desc A leA (x :: nil) | d_conc : forall (x y : A) (l : list A), Relation_Operators.clos_refl A leA x y -> Relation_Operators.Desc A leA (l ++ y :: nil) -> Relation_Operators.Desc A leA ((l ++ y :: nil) ++ x :: nil) Arguments Relation_Operators.Desc _%type_scope _%function_scope _%list_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.d_nil _%type_scope _%function_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.d_one _%type_scope _%function_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.d_conc _%type_scope _%function_scope _ _ _%list_scope
subcode_trans : forall P (Q R : nat * list X), P <sc Q -> Q <sc R -> P <sc R
subcode = fun P (Q : nat * list X) => let (i, li) := P in let (n, code) := Q in exists l r : list X, code = l ++ li ++ r /\ i = n + length l : code -> nat * list X -> Prop Arguments subcode _ _ /
Lexicographic_Exponentiation.desc_tail : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (x : list A) (a b : A), Relation_Operators.Desc A leA (b :: x ++ a :: nil) -> Relation_Operators.clos_refl_trans A leA a b
subcode_app_end : forall P (n : nat) (l r : list X), P <sc (n, l) -> P <sc (n, l ++ r)
ZifyClasses.mkrel : forall (S T : Type) (R : S -> S -> Prop) (I : S -> T) (TR : T -> T -> Prop), (forall n m : S, R n m <-> TR (I n) (I m)) -> forall (s1 : S) (t1 : T), I s1 = t1 -> forall (s2 : S) (t2 : T), I s2 = t2 -> R s1 s2 < -> TR t1 t2
Lexicographic_Exponentiation.desc_prefix : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (x : list A) (a : A), Relation_Operators.Desc A leA (x ++ a :: nil) -> Relation_Operators.Desc A leA x
subcode_right : forall (n m : nat) (l r : list X), n = m + length l -> (n, r) <sc (m, l ++ r)
subcode_length_le : forall P (Q : nat * list X), P <sc Q -> fst Q <= fst P /\ fst P + length (snd P) <= fst Q + length (snd Q)
subcode_start_in_code : forall P (Q : nat * list X), 0 < code_length P -> P <sc Q -> in_code (code_start P) Q
subcode_length' : forall P (Q : nat * list X), P <sc Q -> length (snd P) <= length (snd Q)
subcode_out_code : forall P (Q : nat * list X) (i : nat), P <sc Q -> out_code i Q -> out_code i P
subcode_in_code : forall P (Q : nat * list X) (i : nat), P <sc Q -> in_code i P -> in_code i Q
subcode_left : forall (n m : nat) (l r : list X), n = m -> (n, l) <sc (m, l ++ r)
subcode_refl : forall P, P <sc P
subcode_length : forall P (Q : nat * list X), P <sc Q -> code_start Q <= code_start P /\ code_end P <= code_end Q
app_eq_unit : forall (A : Type) (x y : list A) (a : A), x ++ y = a :: nil -> x = nil /\ y = a :: nil \/ x = a :: nil /\ y = nil
Permutation.Permutation_length_2_inv : forall (A : Type) (a1 a2 : A) (l : list A), a1 :: a2 :: nil ~p l -> l = a1 :: a2 :: nil \/ l = a2 :: a1 :: nil
ZMicromega.cnf_of_list = fun (T : Type) (tg : T) (l : list (RingMicromega.NFormula BinNums.Z)) => fold_right (fun (x : RingMicromega.NFormula BinNums.Z) (acc : list (list (RingMicromega.NFormula BinNums.Z * T))) => if ZMicromega.Zunsat x then acc else ((x, tg) :: nil) :: acc) (Tauto.cnf_tt (RingMicromega.NFormula BinNums.Z) T) l : forall T : Type, T -> list (RingMicromega.NFormula BinNums.Z) -> list (list (RingMicromega.NFormula BinNums.Z * T)) Arguments ZMicromega.cnf_of_list {T}%type_scope _ _%list_scope
partition_inv_nil : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> bool) (l : list A), partition f l = (nil, nil) < -> l = nil
list_cons_app_cons_eq_inv : forall (X : Type) (l2 r1 r2 : list X) (x y : X), x :: r1 = l2 ++ y :: r2 -> (l2 = nil /\ x = y /\ r1 = r2) + {m : list X | l2 = x :: m /\ r1 = m ++ y :: r2}

```coq
```coq
intro H.
destruct H as [|[i li] [j Q1]].
- apply subcode_refl.
- destruct Q1 as [Q1|];[|apply subcode_refl].
  + apply subcode_trans with (2:=H).
    apply subcode_left; trivial.
  + apply subcode_app_end in H; [|apply subcode_refl].
    apply subcode_trans with (2:=H).
    apply subcode_left; trivial.
Qed.```
